snippet.title: Sonic: Fan Games/Hacks 404: Sonic Nexus (2006-2008)
snippet.description:
(These are my simple game play videos)
(I can and will remove specific videos if its necessary/requested)

Name: Sonic Nexus - Demo
Credit: Slingerland (Nexus Team)
Release Date: Possibly 2006-2008

My Website: https://scaleyfoxy.weebly.com/

Download: Only on Site.

(SAGE 2006)
00:00 - Boot&Title 
01:10 - Cosmic Chaos Act 1
06:37 - End Screen
06:51 - Alternative Path

(NeXmas)
09:40 - Boot&Title 
10:04 - Emerald Hill Act 1 & Boss
14:29 - End Screen

(Engine Test)
14:41 - Base Level III Test Zone

(SAGE 2007)
20:17 - Boot&Title (Old&NEw)
22:09 - Pristine Palisade Zone Act 1
27:45 - Pristine Palisade Zone Act 2 (W.I.P)
31:20 - Boss Act Old
36:11 - End Screen
36:15 - Act 2 Alternative Path & Breaking The Game
41:38 - Boss Act Final

(2008)
42:21 - Boot&Intro
43:39 - Title
44:00 - Sunset Shore Zone Act 1
46:34 - Sunset Shore Zone Act 2

NOTES: Alright, time to take a look at that Nexus game finally & add it to the Archive.
And from what I have learned... Is that... Meh? It's alright at best.
With that being said my blind rundown opinion is as follows.

2006 - The Remix Music is very nice, even includes names of various people and games.
NeXmas - So this one is interesting, the Boss & Music is silly enough that I kinda love it.

Engine Test - It's alright, early look at Pristine really & Super Sonic.

2007 - Oh boy... This one is kinda frustrating, not because it's a Water Level.
But because the air bubbles are so incredibly RNG based that you have 80% chance to die.
The bubbles can also get in your way as well, Act 2 is the worst probably.
But the Boss I think is pretty cool.
That being said the Old Version has all 3 Acts slightly different.
The final version has Act 1 slightly improved but the air bubble issue still exists.
Act 2 is removed with some areas of it fused with Act 1 & Boss Act slightly changed.
Overall not very good due to the issues it has.

2008 - So Taxman enters the schene here and the game goes from Fusion Engine to the Retro Engine instead.
A sudden big change out of no where I say.
That being said you probably won't notice the swap in Engines, but the two acts are nice & simple, sadly no Boss.
